page.title: 01Sandridge - Gazeteer
page.content: Sandridge is a small village in open farmland with Nomansland Common and Symondshyde Wood nearby. Sandridge is in the south of the block; to the east is Sandridgebury, a smaller settlement. In the past Sandridge had as many as 6 shops and a cafe. Now there is only a small grocers, an off-licence and a sub-post office, which has recently been threatened with closure. Pound Farm and the Old People's Home are owned by the Salvation Army and are situated near to St. Leonards Church. Coleman's Green is a small settlement. It is a small rural community with a public house and boarding kennels.Until fairly recently, Sandridge was a farming community but with increasing mechanisation the percentage of the population engaged in farming has decreased.
